clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of MBSR Among Teachers at Upper Secondary Schools and Schools of Health and Social Care
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Online Mindfulness-based Stress Reduction Among Teachers at Upper Secondary Schools and Schools of Health and Social Care

brief_summary.textblock: The aim is to evaluate the effectiveness of online Mindfulness-based Stress Reduction among school teachers in Danish upper secondary schools and schools of health and social care on mental well-being in the teachers and their students. The study is a cluster-randomised trial including 43 schools; 76 teachers; 1.000 students.

primary_outcome.description: Change in perceived stress among the school teachers

secondary_outcome.time_frame: post MBSR (8 weeks from baseline) and 12 months from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in perceived stress among the school teachers

secondary_outcome.time_frame: post MBSR (8 weeks from baseline), 6 and 12 months from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in resilience among the school teachers

secondary_outcome.time_frame: post MBSR (8 weeks from baseline), 6 and 12 months from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in symptoms of anxiety and depression among the school teachers

secondary_outcome.time_frame: post MBSR (8 weeks from baseline), 6 and 12 months from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in well-being among the school teachers

secondary_outcome.time_frame: post MBSR (8 weeks from baseline), 6 and 12 months from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in mindfulness among the school teachers

secondary_outcome.time_frame: post MBSR (8 weeks from baseline), 6 and 12 months from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in resting state among the school teachers

arm_group.description: MBSR according to international standards (2.5 hours group session once a week in 8 weeks; a silence retreat day; and 45-60 minutes homework six days a week). Content in accordance with MBSR curriculum.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- School teacher at a Danish upper secondary school or school of health and social care that commit to participate in a trial aiming to implement and evaluate the effectiveness of a school-based mindfulness programme.
Exclusion Criteria:
- acute treatment-demanding clinical depression or a diagnosis of psychosis or schizophrenia
- abuse of alcohol, drugs, medicine
